instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
lcd cable is broken, <CAPACITOR>C9715</CAPACITOR> is broken in half, i removed it, but there's a short but not full short, about 20 ohm.
I then proceed to remove <CAPACITOR>C9709</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9799</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9795</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9717</CAPACITOR>. But there's a short ? about 50 ohm, does that mean there's still leakage ?
i cannot inject voltage like this, is my best bet to remove all caps ? there's a small crater at c9795pin 1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
Polish the "crater" edge.
You probably have leakage between copper layers.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
i have found the short beneath some layer, now <SIGNAL>BKLT_BOOST</SIGNAL> resistance is around 1.7k ohm, i use caps thats the same size for the caps i removed before, is that okay ? or should i use same specification? diode mode 0.293
if i pwoer it on without screen, its normal, but when i power it on with screen, i smell some burn but idoesnt found anything blown..
l9100 is 0.5 ohm resistance, is that okay ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR> is shorted. is there any part from macbook donor i can use ? i can't seem to find any..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR> is shorted"
I have never heard about shorted resistor!!!
What do you expect from a 50 miliohm resistor???

Did you check resistance to ground at backlight output with LCD connected?
If no short, the smell denotes the backlight voltage try to go high and leakage still present between copper layers.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
but that resistor is connected to ground, and the resistance is 0.1 ohm.. correct me if im wrong
iassume <SIGNAL>PP12V_LCD</SIGNAL> is the output ? resistance to ground is about 2k ohm with screen connected.
any replacement for this <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR> ? cause its blown..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message: when i see 0.1 ohm resistance to ground on <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR>, i then inject voltage there which blown <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
:eek:
I cannot beleave that!!!
Good luck to find replacement resistor now.

I cannot help if do not even read me...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
im sorry.. i read every your message carefully.. english is not my native language so ims orry if i miss something.
yes i read that resistor is 50mili ohm, but there's no resistor package with that size from donor board, is it okay if i use smaller resistor with jumper wire ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message: wait.. even jumper wire is at least 0.1 ohm in resistance..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
You had 0.05 ohm (50 miliohm) resistance.
What reading did you expect to get, apart of pure short???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message:
i have replaced the <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR>
I have pp12v going
I can seeimage by flashing the lcd, so its no backlight problem to be exact..
L9100 is fine
f9700 is fine
I have tried replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q9700</TRANSISTOR> too
diode mode <DIODE>D9700</DIODE> with another board, similar result.. any idea ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message: I have another board so I already eliminate lcd and display cable problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A imac no display
threads.message: If you have working board, then compare diode mode readings between boards, in the backlight area.
